column4: how do i post the output of lspci and lsusb to .txt? ie lsusb.txt and lspci.txt
$lspci > lspci.txt
would cat lspci > lspci.txt do the same thing?
no
all you would wind up doing is writing the word lspci into a file lspci.txt
ok $lspci > lspci.txt in my home dir does nothing, puts a blank .txt file in my home
is this because im not running lspci as su?
nm, dont need su for lspci
$less lspci.txt   does nothing?
haha nm, $ means at term, my bad
haha I was about to tell you to remove the $
i can output any command to a txt with foo > output.txt
for example uname -r > output.txt\
yes, and you can target what you output from a command using grep
so lspci > lspci.txt | grep VGA would output only my nvidia line?
so say I only want to see ethernet adaptors from lspci,
no like this, $lspci | grep -i vga > output.txt
i option ignores everything BUT vga correct?
no -i ignores case
type in $grep --help
it will tell you everyhting there is to know about grep =)
man grep im reading...dont know what case distinctions are...?
figure it out?
yes sir
